DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Occurring or operating at the same time._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of gathering something together.:Quantity; how much there is of something that you can measure.

Concepts.definition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
